Twilight Imperium plus the expansion Shattered Empire.  We will be starting at 10pm on Friday night, and playing until we have a winner.  If you plan to join us for the event, be prepared to be up all night with a very complicated galactic conquest board game.   Races of the galaxy will be chosen randomly, and we will discuss what features of the expansion we will use after all players are present.  Stay up all night with this unique game, and get more Nanocon in your system this year.

I would host a demo of Virtual Reality games using the HTC vive and Oculus Rift.  Ideally, I would have a space of about 20ft by 20ft, to allow clearance for movement within the virtual space.  I can work with less, preferably no less than 9x9 ft for the playspace and a separate table to host my computer/monitor/sign up sheets.  I would have a schedule with sign up sheets and various game options for attendees to try out.  I would host two stations, one sitting experience at the table with my desktop (and laptop) and another in the open space cleared for VR play using the HTC vive.  I would have time slots of 15 minutes per person, so I could host about 8 people per hour, one on the seated Rift experience, one on the Vive movement experience.

Enter the World of Hero Quest...If You Dare! It's like no other game you've ever played! Dark caverns. Gory monsters. Deadly traps...and worse! Once you enter the mysterious underground world of Hero Quest, there's no turning back. Which daring hero will you be? THE BARBARIAN: The mightiest warrior! Few can match him in mortal combat! THE ELF: A proud champion with fighting skills matched only by his magic! THE WIZARD: A master of sorcery. His knowledge and use of magic is unrivaled. THE DWARF: A fearless fighter with a unique ability to disarm traps. Your first Quest is about to begin! Will the evil forces of doom be stopped? Will the land be saved from destruction? It's all up to you. Good luck!

column2: Settlers of America: Trails to Rails
column9: The 19th Century has arrived and America is heading west. Wagon trains form on the frontier. Settlers seeking fresh lives and opportunities strike out to tame wild lands and build new cities. These new cities rely on young railroads for vital goods. Trails become rails and create great wealth. While the crowded East still offers options, its resources dwindle. Look west to make your fortune. Smart money seeks rich, unclaimed land and hungry new markets. Finance your settlers as they head west to build capitals of tomorrow. Link these cities with rails of steel. Operate your railroad to supply the townsfolk with goods. Go west. Settle the wide, open land. Claim your destiny. Settlers of America, Trails to Rails utilizes the simple, fun Catan hex-tile grid to map the young United States. Collect and trade resources in order to purchase and move settlers, build cities, lay rails and acquire and move trains. Create rail links to acquire gold, which lets you buy resources and use opponents' rails. Use trains to distribute goods to rival cities. But, as your settlers populate the West, they deplete the resources of the East. Still, your options always abound.

Closet cosplay is a panel that focuses on great ways to save money while still portraying characters you love. During this hour Cassandra Rain will have many different examples of closet cosplay she has put together. Come talk tips with her and hopefully get inspired to start cosplaying!

column2: D&D Adventures League DDAL 4-10 The Artifact (Level 5-10)
column9: An expedition to the Amber Temple reveals another major minion of the enemy and uncovers a secret weapon that may help defeat them. Part ten of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts. Level 5-10

column2: D&D Adventures League DDAL 4-11 The Donjon (Level 5-10))
column9: The village of Ora?nou is panicked when a group of Bloodhand orcs appear at the edge of the woods. They bring news and an unusual request that reveals a new foe. Part eleven of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts. Level 5-10

column2: D&D Adventures League DDAL 4-12 The Raven (Level 5-10)
column9: The Bloodhand orcs have a prisoner that may hold the answers to the strange goings on and the key to stopping the enemy. Now you just have to convince them to hand the prisoner over. Part twelve of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts. Level 5-10

column2: D&D Adventures League DDAL 4-13 The Horsemen (Level 5-10)
column9: The unexpected ally imparts the secret you have been searching for and now only one more puppet remains before you can finally face the enemy. Unfortunately your allies begin to pay the price for your interference in the enemyís plans. Part thirteen of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts. Level 5-10

column2: D&D Adventuers League DDAL 4-14 The Dark Lord (Level 5-10)
column9: The enemy is revealed, but time is short and if you are not successful in your mission to Mount Baratok, love will never die. Part fourteen and the finale of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts. Level 5-10

column2: D&D Adventures League DDEX 3-16 Assault on Maerimydra (Level 11-16)
column9: The time has come for the brave and the bold to put an end to the machinations of Maerimydraís demonic occupiers and their fiendish fire giant ruler. This will be no mean feat; the city is a cesspit of corruption and madness. You will have help, however, as an unlikely group of allies have gathered to your side in the Underdark beneath Faer˚n. Danger, glory, and redemption await those brave enough to seize it. Level 11-16

column2: D&D Adventures League DDEX 2-3 The Drowned Tower (Level 5-10)
column9: You are approached by someone claiming to be a member of the Brotherhood of the Cloak investigating unusual incidents involving some of his brethren. Discretion is vital, as there is rumored to be a link between the denizens of the Tower of Arcane Might and one of the elemental cults. Can you uncover the truth? Level 5-10

column2: D&D Adventures League DDEX 2-13 The Howling Void (Level 5-10)
column9: A bastion of the Cult of the Howling Wind has been located beneath the Monastery of the Yellow Rose in the bowels of the Earthspur Mountains. In order to thwart the cultís plans for Mulmasterís destruction, you must delve into the depths and quell the storm within. While their winds still blow, none in Mulmaster are truly safe. Level 5-10

column2: D&D Adventures League CORE 1-1 A Scream in the Night (Level 1-4)
column9: Melvaunt is a city of merchants and metalsmiths. The docks are constantly filled with ships from Hillsfar, Mulmaster, and more distant ports. The northern coast of the Moonsea is an inhospitable place, and its people have a reputation for being rough and unfriendly. But they donít go around murdering one another in the streets. At least, not usually. Was that a scream you just heard? Part One of The Chaos in Melvaunt. Level 1-4

column2: D&D Adventures League CORE 1-2 A Cog in the Wheel (Level 1-4)
column9:
With the identity of a murderer confirmed, heroes are needed to track it down to its home. As it turns out, it might be a longer journey than first imagined.
Part Two of The Chaos in Melvaunt. Level 1-4

column2: D&D Adventures League CORE 1-3 A Hole in the World
column9:
Threats from outside Melvaunt and within push heroes to the brink as a terrified populace counts on the bravery of a few heroes to avert total disaster.
Part Three of The Chaos in Melvaunt. Level 1-4

column2: D&D Adventures League PAXW2016 Cloud Giant's Bargain (Level 5-7)
column9: The renowned adventuring company Acquisitions Inc. hires you to infiltrate a castle--but not just any castle. This is a flying fortress built by the cloud giant Count Stratovan, who is currently preparing to destroy the Sword Coast. Your mission is to meet with his son, who claims to want to prevent the war and establish peace between the giants and the small folk. If you can learn whether the son can be trusted, discover the secrets of the castle, and... well, survive, you too can earn acclaim with Acquisitions Inc.! Level 5-7

column2: D&D Adventures League DDEX 1-12 Raiders of the Twilight Marsh (Level 5-10)
column9: A black dragonís treasure horde has been located in the Twilight Marsh, and within it are secrets that hold interest to the factions. With the dragon marauding over the countryside, the horde is left unguarded. Now is the time to plunder its lair! An adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

Learn to play the anime-based trading card game Cardfight!! Vanguard. The official website gives it the description :"On a planet much like the Earth called ‚ÄúCray‚Äù, you battle your opponent with the help of your units. Cardfighters become Vanguards, and lead their units towards victory!" No cards are necessary for the demo though, if you have a deck even better!

http://cf-vanguard.com/en/

column2: D&D Adventurer's League 5-1 Treasure of the Broken Hoard
column9:
A famous relic hunter seeks adventurers to help her find caches of treasure hidden by the now-
defeated followers of the Cult of the Dragon.

Her maps and notes may lead the way to great wealth‚Äîor a terrible death.

And do other parties have designs on the treasure as well?

Five 1-Hour Mini-Adventures for 1st & 2nd Level Characters

column2: D&D Adventurer's League 5-2 The Black Road
column9:
Caravans are having a difficult time getting through to Parnast via the Black Road.

Organized attacks by orcs and other monstrous humanoids working in concert with one another have folks baffled. Little do they know that an unusually intelligent hill giant, going by the name of Bad Fruul is to blame.

SEER has sent her emissary Hsing, to task your group to accompany a caravan with a very special cargo destined for the Shrine of Axes in Parnast, and to figure out who is responsible.

A Two Hour Adventure for 1st-4th Level Characters

The Shrine of the Axes has been restored and Raggnar Redtooth, who previously conspired with dragon cultists, is trying to restore his reputation in Parnast by sponsoring a feast.

There is just one thing he needs, meat for his feast. Game is supposed to be plentiful in the Weathercote Wood, but the townsfolk are all busy with their own work, and the minions of Bad Fruul are still out there causing trouble.

What can go wrong on a simple hunt?

A Two-Hour Adventure for 1st-4th Level Characters

column2: D&D Adventurer's League 5-4 In Dire Need
column9: An expedition of dwarf warriors from Citadel Adbar finds itself isolated and besieged by Ice Spire ogres and their allies. They require immediate relief or they risk being destroyed to a dwarf. SEER has directed you to their location in the hopes that you can rescue the dwarves and save their precious cargo, a tablet bearing secrets of ancient rune magic.

column2: D&D Adventurer's League 5-5 A Dish Best Served Cold
column9:
Among the Story of Stagwick, giants are a recurring theme, but a long-standing peace with giant-kind is now threatened as a patrol of Blood Riders spark a feud with a local tribe of giants. With word of strange activity coming from the Ice Spires, Good King Hartwick can‚Äôt be too careful. Can you quench the giants‚Äôs thirst for revenge?

For character's level 5-10

column2: "Into The Deep Dark Depth" Dread Adventure Playtest
column9:
The full moon rose on the equinox and now you and six other Athenian youth have been chosen. Nine years ago your king‚Äôs son, Theseus, was sent with the third tribute and did not return. Now you‚Äôve been chosen to be sent to Crete in sacrifice to the monster there. In this dread adventure you must make your way through the maze of the Minotaur. Find Theseus‚Äôs equipment and kill the Minotaur deep within the maze. Just make sure you don‚Äôt fall under the pressure.

My team has been working hard writing this adventure and would like to get feed back from experienced rpg players both familiar with the Dread system and not.
I will have multiple decks provided, for those who do not have edh magic decks.  Once enough players are ready, a group game will commence.

Missed the Friday session but still want to learn the fun anime themed collectible card game? Or maybe now that you know you want to practice your skills for the Sunday tournament? We are doing the demo again! Join us!

Flashbax will be hosting a 48 hour MTG Commander event. We need min. of 8 people for this event. Each player must have a legal Commander Deck (WotC legal). Each player will play best 2 out of 3, no more than a total of 5 matches throughout the day. Each player may not play the same person more than 1 time a day. Points will be rewarded as follows: Loss=1, tie=2, win=3. Each player will get a free promotional card for participating. Top 3 will get very cool prizes as well.

We Be Goblins! is an adventure for 1st-level characters in which the PCs play a horde of malicious and murderous goblins, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world's oldest RPG.
"We Be Goblins Too!" is an adventure for four 3rd-level goblin characters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world's oldest roleplaying game.
We Be Goblins Free! is an adventure for four 4th-level goblin characters, written for the award-winning Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.
We B4 Goblins is an adventure for four goblin characters just beginning their careers of mischief and mayhem, written for the award-winning Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

Two rival spymasters know the secret identities of 25 agents. Their teammates know the agents only by their CODENAMES.

In Codenames, two teams compete to see who can make contact with all of their agents first. Spymasters give one-word clues that can point to multiple words on the board. Their teammates try to guess words of the right color while avoiding those that belong to the opposing team. And everyone wants to avoid the assassin.

Codenames: Win or lose, it's fun to figure out the clues.

It is National Novel Writing Month, and many are furiously scratching pencil to paper. For those who love writing, who are looking to have a break, or who are looking to find others working on this lofty goal, this is the event for you! Paper and pencils will be provided, as well as a character design who will stand in as a loose prompt for those who need to get creative juices flowing. At the end of the hour, the character design will be given to whoever writes the most compelling backstory!

The obstacle you have is that their is a traitor among you, can you find the right traitors? column2: Tales of- Which one should I play again?
column9:
Interested in trying out one of the Tales of Games? They have a lot of different games out and have been going strong for 21 years and their sixteenth entry will have its US Release in January 2017. 
Games in the Alley: (PS3, 4-Player) Tales of Symphonia, Tales of Graces F, Tales of Xilla, Tales of Xilla 2, (PS3, 2-Player) Tales of Symphonia Dawn of a New World, (Vita/PSTV, 1-Player) Tales of Hearts R, (PS2, 4-Player, If it works out) Tales of the Abyss

Social Deception games are games whose primary focus is lying and detecting liars. Games such as: Coup, Secret Hitler, One Night Ultimate Werewolf, and The Resistance are all short games that you can spend 15-30 minutes playing. Another game that might (provided enough players want to play it and have the time to play) be played is Battlestar Galactica(120-240 minutes play time). 

Coup (2-6 players): There are 5 different influence cards and each one has 3 copies of it in the deck.The game starts with each player having 2 influence cards and two coins. Each type of influence card has different actions it can provide during your[the player] turn. During other players turn you have counteractions that you influence cards give you. This is where the social deception is. Players can and will bluff! One card is the Duke, each turn the duke can take something called duke tax which grants him 3 coins as opposed to 1. Many players will start play claiming to be a duke such as if there are 5 players each one claims to be a Duke you know there is only 3 dukes, odds are a few players are bluffing you can try to call them out or just let it play.

Secret Hitler (5-10 players): The political agenda has been swayed, fascist are now attempting to seize control of the political regime, and put Hitler into power. There are two factions, liberals and fascists, each has their own objectives in order to win. The liberals are trying to pass 5 liberal policies or kill Hitler. Fascists are trying to pass 6 fascists policies or get Hitler into the chancellor office after the 3 fascist policy has been played. At the start of the game players find out what side they are on and then all players close their eyes and then Hitler gives a signal (raises his thumb) while keeping his eyes closed as the fascists open their eyes identify the other fascists and identify who Hitler is. There are multiple ways of play but this is generally how the game is played. More rules regarding play are in the instructions.

One Night Ultimate Werewolf (3-10 players): The villagers have uncovered a frightening truth there are werewolves nearby. There are a lot mechanics in this game so much so that I can't pick out what to say for it. Essentially, the villagers have to work out who the werewolf is or are out of their group and agree (via vote) to kill said player(s). Be careful though since there may be no werewolves.

The Resistance (5-10 players): Revolution can be difficult to pull off, especially when spies have infiltrated your ranks. You[the players] are attempting to overthrow an Empire and free your allies through the successful completion of various missions set out by teams of players. However, complications can arise when others are acting against this agenda from within your own ranks.

Battlestar Galactica (3-6 players): This game is similar to how the actual series was in the remake from 2004. Players are in a desperate race to get to Kobol before the spy can implement major parts of their plan.

Use a die, action cards, crystals, and other players to defeat monsters. By defeating monsters you gain crystals. Players can trade action cards, crystals and services to defeat monsters,  while also trying to be the first to collect 2 of each color, thereby transcending to the rainbow ruler of the universe.

Seven people and I have created teams in Pokemon Showdown. We have declared ourselves to be Gym Leaders. Throughout the days of Nanocon people will be able to challenge each of us a maximum of twice a day. Depending on the number of people who are capable of beating all eight Gym Leaders we may or may not have them face off against each other to determine the "Elite Four" and potentially a "Champion." If there are fewer players who are capable of beating all eight Gyms, the battle for "Elite Four" and "Champion" will not be necessary. The players who manage to beat all of the Gym Leaders and earn the title of either "Elite Four" member or "Champion" will be rewarded with a set of Kanto badge pins, which will be purchased by us, The Gym Leaders.

Players will be allowed to make any team they want using Pokemon Showdown with a few restrictions. All pokemon on their team must be validated in the "Ubers" tier according to Pokemon Showdown. There is also a limit to one of any pokemon to a team. All "legendary" and "mythic" pokemon are banned from the event; if a specific pokemon's legality for the event is in question, the player can ask one of the Gym Leaders participating in the event. Once players have arranged their team, they cannot change it throughout the event. Players are limited to the six pokemon they choose to put into their team. When a player defeats one of the Gym Leaders, whichever Gym Leader the player defeated will record the player's name and team. In the event that a player has changed the members of their team between matches, any matches they win will not count toward the event.
